name: Korpokkur
text:
If I leave you to a bunch of useless human-making machines like you,
I don't know how you'll turn out, so stop it already!

That was a page from a memory in Kamuy Kotan,
one of the 23 otherworlds connected to Tokyo.

The wolves and bears if Kamuy bickered with each other,
arguing over the educational policy for the next heroic child.

name: Korpokkur
text:
The Kamuy are really too lenient with this child of a hero.
They don't understand that sometimes, the harshness of winter is necessary.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Honestly, that's why I, the little one,
have to watch over him properly... Huh?

name: Korpokkur
text:
Hey, don't hold my hand with
those tiny hands... Ugh, come on.

I changed his diapers, fed him milk,
and watched him grow up all this time.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Ah, you're so cute.
How could you not be?

name: Korpokkur
text:
You are a Kamuy who looks like a human.
I wished for the happiness of you, little hero, more than anyone else.

name: Korpokkur
text:
That's why, if you say that you wanted
to live among humans, I probably... can't stop you.

Kamuy Kotan has a legend about
the end of the little hero, Aynurakkur.

It is said that Aynurakkur fought against the demons and
monsters that threatened the humans and brought peace to the world.

But in the end, he left the humans who had fallen
into corruption and departed from this world—

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Go on, Aynurakkur.
Go somewhere else, anywhere but here.

Amidst the disaster that covered the world,
someone whispered to the little hero in a voice he couldn't hear.

name: Korpokkur
text:
If you stay here, your future is already decided...
So, find somewhere else to call your home.

name: Korpokkur
text:
I will forever banish you from this closed-off world with limited resources.
I, the 'World Representative'.

name: Korpokkur
text:
So, you, as a child, can live your
life happily somewhere else, ignorant of this world.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Hey, now.
Have you been listening to me carefully?

Walking through a city far away from Kamuy Kotan,
the boy spoke quietly to the person next to him.

name: Korpokkur
text:
I have a lot of thoughts about Christmas.
Oh, keep this a secret from the children.

name: Korpokkur
text:
They say good children get presents from adults, but that's just
nonsense from people who believe that 'becoming an adult is a good thing'.

name: Korpokkur
text:
To me, good kids and bad kids are all just kids.
And kids are sometimes colder than anything else.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...To be honest, this grumbling is because of an old memory.
It reminds me of my bitter past.

name: Korpokkur
text:
There was a time when I also acted like Santa.
That was when I was young and foolish.

name: Korpokkur
text:
But it didn't go well...
And I'm not going to complain to you like a child either.

On the day of the Santa Departure Ceremony,
Korpokkur smiled in satisfaction as he watched the happy children.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I don't really care.
I'm just happy watching the children here.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Yes, yes, Merry Christmas.
Go play with the children, will you?

options.text: Here, some snacks as a present.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
For me...?
No matter how long it has been, you're still a child, and you always manage to make me want to cry.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Show me that you're having fun like a child.
That would make me the happiest.

options.text: I want to have fun with you~

name: Korpokkur
text:
Ah, damn it, nothing will change
even if you keep being irresponsibly stubborn!

name: Korpokkur
text:
...If a child says so, I guess I have no choice.
Alright, what do you want to do?

name: Korpokkur
text:
You're surprisingly observant.
You never grow up, but you're not too bad yourself, [Player].

name: Korpokkur
text:
But don't look at me too much.
That would make a little person hiding under a butterbur gets shy.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Actually, I don't like Christmas that much.
I know it's a little too late to say that.

options.text: But isn't it an event for children to be happy?
I feel like there's more to it than that.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Maybe you're right.
I may be in love of you too much.

name: Korpokkur
text:
You're right, there's another reason.
Christmas is— Christmas is—

name: Korpokkur
text: It's filled with slimy adult couples making out!

name: Korpokkur
text:
That's bad for children to see!
Shouldn't children be spared of knowing about such things!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
That's not it!
I care about children's future the most!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Romance...
You'd know the ending before you even start, right?

options.text: Children grow up to be adults someday.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...I know that better than anyone.
But it's just a childish game, so it's okay.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Romance...
You'd know the ending before you even start, right?

options.text: You're saying that even though you love me.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Did you have to say that so suddenly!?
Well, about that...

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
But, when it comes to romance...
You'd know the ending before you even start, right?

text:
Korpokkur's lonely gaze was fixed on two children
holding hands, with smiles beaming on their face―

name: Korpokkur
text:
I want children to be happy, but I do know that I can
only measure their happiness so much by my own standards.

name: Korpokkur
text:
But you know, predictable unhappiness
is just unnecessary for children.

name: Korpokkur
text:
A person's feelings are fleeting, right?
We shouldn't rely on something like that... It won't be good.

options.text: Did something happen in your past?
Oops, did I step on a landmine...?

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Nothing happened like you're thinking.
My selling point is being as pure and clean as snow.

name: Korpokkur
text:
I've never really taken anyone to heart.
...I've only ever been in love a tiny bit.

options.text: Let's stop thinking about difficult things and just have fun!

text:
[Player] pulled Korpokkur by the hand
towards the party venue, where everyone was having fun.

Their hand was so cold that Korpokkur
found it pleasant to hold.

It felt like a testament to the fact that they
had struggled to live in a cold, frozen environment.

name: Korpokkur
text:
You got so cold for me...?
No, you probably just looked for me without a second thought.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Huh? You, what's with that outfit—
Oh, I see. Okay, I'll join you.

After changing into a space ranger uniform,
Korpokkur followed [Player].

When they arrived at the indoor party venue,
the children noticed them and greeted them with all their might.

name: Trickster
text:
He's here!
It's our space ranger, Goronyapokkur!

name: Trickster
text:
Captain! We have successfully gathered some unknown food!
We need you to analyze its components!

The children offered Korpokkur some party food,
implicitly telling him to go ahead and eat.

Korpokkur was surprised by his popularity,
but he immediately put on the face of a confident space ranger captain.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Alright, good work, everyone.
I'll go ahead and start the analysis!

He took a piece of chicken from a plate
the children were offering and stuffed his mouth.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Gulp. This is delicious!
Listen up, rookie rangers! I'm issuing an emergency mission!

name: Korpokkur
text:
Hurry and gobble up this food for your training!
But don't push yourselves, okay? It's supposed to be fun!

name: Children
text:
Yes, sir! Let's go, go, go,
it's a mission from the captain!

Korpokkur smiled happily at the children
as they rushed toward the food.

options.text: The kids really love you, Korpokkur.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Yeah... I guess so.
Thanks for taking me along, [Player].

Other children noticed Korpokkur,
and started gathering around him as well.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Looks like I've been called, so I'm gonna go.
[Player], wait for me here.

options.text: So you lost to the kids, huh~?

name: Korpokkur
text:
What is it?
Do you need something from me, Space Ranger Goronyapokkur?

name: Child
text:
Hey, that person who was next to you just now...
Are they someone you like, Korpokkur?

name: Trickster
text:
I heard a rumor recently that
Korpokkur has a special someone.

name: Korpokkur
text:
W-W-W-What are you talking about!?
Me and them... We're not like that.

name: Korpokkur
text:
And what do you mean by 'rumor'?
You guys really like talking about that stuff during this season, huh?

Korpokkur's cheeks turned crimson.
He wondered if he had been that obvious.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...I'm not going to cherish a special someone anymore.
It's better for me to be cold and fair to everyone.

The children looked at each other
after hearing Korpokkur's words.

name: Child
text:
Why not?
I'll always love my Mom and Dad.

name: Trickster
text:
Me too, me too!
I think I'll always love Korpokkur too!

name: Korpokkur
text:
Haha, thanks.
To be like that, I love you kids too.

It was a very childish answer.
Lovingly pure and untainted―

That's why, Korpokkur wanted
to be cold and fair to all races.

Because from his past experiences, he knew that if
he only loved one race, the world would be trapped in mud.

He knew that an end would come.
Korpokkur was the only one who could see the time limit.

He knew that he would have to say goodbye
to the children he loved so much one day—

name: Child
text:
Korpokkur...?
Can you hear us?

name: Korpokkur
text:
Huh? Oh, sorry.
I was just thinking.

name: Trickster
text:
Come on, hurry up and go to them!
Christmas is all about being with the people you care about the most!

name: Korpokkur
text:
Well, you guys are important
to me too, but... I get it.

Korpokkur called out to [Player] again, and as they left
the party venue, he changed his clothes again.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Sorry, [Player].
There was a weird rumor going around with the kids, so I wanted to change locations.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I'm glad you're okay with it.
I've got some food, so let's talk for a bit.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Yeah, they practically forced me out...
Kids these days really have their feelings developed too fast.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...I'm not telling you.
It's a secret, a se-cr-et!

text:
Korpokkur spread out the food
he brought on the dine-in space.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Come on, let's sit and eat.
I even got some cake.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Why did you sit next to me?
The seat in front is empty, but I guess it's fine.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Whoa, hey, it's hard to eat like this!
What do you think you are doing!?
Korpokkur struggled a bit in resistance, and then sat next to [Player], telling them to 'deal with it'.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Hey, [Player]. Do you think there's such a
thing as unchanging, or rather, impartial happiness?

options.text: I don't know, but I'm sure it exists.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I see. I had a feeling you'd say that.
Make sure to keep that childish part of you, in a way that's easy for me to understand.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I see. I had a feeling you'd say that.
Make sure to keep that childish part of you, in a way that's easy for me to understand.

options.text: If you want to believe, then you should believe.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...What's that supposed to mean?
If I don't believe in it, will you take responsibility?

name: Korpokkur
text:
Well... as you can probably guess from a question like that,
I believe that it can only exist for a moment.

name: Korpokkur
text:
Of course, I also wish that something like that could exist universally.
I'd ask Santa for it if I could.

name: Korpokkur
text:
But that's right, if the kids
believe that 'love is forever'—

name: Korpokkur
text:
I shouldn't deny them.
I have to protect them.

Korpokkur wouldn't meet their eyes,
so it was obvious what he meant.

options.text: It's okay, I'll make you believe.
I want to know if something like that exists, too.

name: Korpokkur
text:
To think about something like impartial love...
I've just learned too many things.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...I just wanted the kids
to be happy, that's all.

name: Korpokkur
text:
You should be happy, [Player].
I'll even be cold to you if it's for the kids.

options.text: Take me to the amusement park again.
You're so cheeky for a kid!

name: Korpokkur
text:
...Hmph, that's what I'm talking about.
Kids say whatever they want without thinking.

name: Korpokkur
text:
But... I love you, you who still are a child.
So much that I want you to stay the same forever.

options.text: Couldn't have done it without you, Korpokkur.
I want you to be like that, too.
All children should be happy, right?

name: Korpokkur
text:
...You're a sneaky kid, you know.
But that's― just the way you are. I know that.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text: Hey. I'm the one who's supposed to do that to the kids I love.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Here, I'll pat your head.
You can act like a kid and be spoiled for a bit.
Korpokkur patted [Player]'s head in the exact same way, and smiled with satisfaction.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Whoa, what's wrong, [Player]?
My cheek is cold, you'll catch a cold...!
Korpokkur was so embarrassed that he turned his face away and hid it with his present bag.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text: ...First, I'll have to see if I can still love you after I make you an adult, okay?
A cold yet warm kiss landed on their cheek, as if it was to make them feel a strange sensation.

text:
Korpokkur thought to himself, that this unnamed feeling
would change one day, just as his experiences had taught him.

Because he felt so happy to be with them, he couldn't help
but be aware of the end that would come once that feeling changed—

options.text: We'd have to enjoy this moment—
Like enjoying winter before spring arrives.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...That's not what I meant.
I was saying I don't want this to end.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...But, [Player], please don't change.
Stay as the person I love... and stay by my side.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Yeah, me too, [Player].
I've been like this since back then...

dialogue_after_selection.name: Korpokkur
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Thanks, [Player].
I love you a lot, too.

name: Korpokkur
text:
...It's getting late.
Why don't you stay over tonight, [Player]?

name: Korpokkur
text:
I'll tuck you in, like a child,
and let you be spoiled.

Unchanging, impartial love doesn't exist.
He believed in it like a layer of snow that never melts, and yet―

Korpokkur, remembering the parting that would come one day,
started to walk alongside [Player].

As the evening drew to a close,
the 'Merry Christmas' song played between the two of them―
